etymologies: early 17th century: from French monogamie, via ecclesiastical Latin from Greek monogamia, from monos ‘single’ + gamos ‘marriage’

definitions: the practice or state of being married to one person at a time

examples.text: Judaism has journeyed from polygamy to strict monogamy

shortDefinitions: practice of marrying or state of being married to one person at time

definitions: the practice or state of having a sexual relationship with only one partner

examples.text: younger men were more likely to stray, saying monogamy was outdated

shortDefinitions: practice or state of having sexual relationship with only one partner

definitions: the habit of having only one mate at a time

examples.text: monogamy is rare in most animal groups, but is common among birds

shortDefinitions: habit of having only one mate at time
